name: The Refillable Dry Shampoo
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Dry Shampoo
about: What it is:A talc-free, refillable dry shampoo powder with a kabuki brush for targeted application that leaves scalp and strands clean and refreshed..Hair Type:Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Texture:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Concerns:- Oily Scalp.Key Benefits:- Absorbs oils and cleanses scalp.Highlighted Ingredients:- Persimmon-Derived Tannic Acid: Deodorizes and leaves hair smelling as clean as wash day..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:Crown Affair‚Äôs Dry Shampoo is a silky and entirely talc-free powder formula. Persimmon-derived tannic acid refreshes and deodorizes while tsubaki seed oil prevents dryness and irritation, leaving hair cleansed with subtle volume‚Äîwithout the grit of traditional aerosol products. The packaging is refillable and comes with an insert that can be removed..Fragrance Description:Crown Affair‚Äôs signature fragrance combines bergamot, yuzu, and lemongrass for a cool, light scent.
ingredients: -Persimmon-Derived Tannic Acid: Deodorizes and leaves hair smelling as clean as wash day..-Tsubaki Seed Oil: Prevents dryness and irritation at the scalp..-Tapioca Starch: Absorbs oils and enriches your scalp without talc....Tapioca Starch, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Starch, Cetrimonium Chloride, Trehalose, Saccharomyces, Persimmon Fruit Juice Ferment Extract, Sodium Bicarbonate, Fragrance (Parfum), Camellia Japonica (Tsubaki) Seed oil, Isodecylneopentanoate, Dimethicone, CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499, Linalool....The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Dip brush into powder lightly..-Apply directly to roots where needed..-Use pads of fingers to further distribute product..-Repeat as necessary until desired look and feel is achieved...To insert the refill: .-Remove your old refill by twisting to the right to release..-Recycle. .-Insert the new refill into the base of the jar..-Twist to the left until it clicks into place. .-Refill is sold separately.

reviews.review_title: Slightly Luxury but with Great Performance
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have come to really enjoy using this dry shampoo on a daily basis!! Here is a run down of different aspects of the product I have observed after constant usage:  1. Packaging: The packaging of this dry shampoo is decent. Especially the newer packaging, it is now refillable with greater amount of product inside. The exterior is plastic, but the container body is made of sanded surface that feels more luxurious than shiny plastic. Product also comes with a brush (but not included in the refill). The brush is quite fluffy and thick in bristle.  2. The powder does have a medium level scent. It strongly reminds me of the D&G Summer Vibes perfume. Very similar to that!! But if I have to describe it, it is almost a passion fruit scent with a slight floral sweetness. Quite elegant.  3. The powder itself. The powder has a consistency and texture similar to tapioca starch/corn starch, although it is more coarse and powder is less finely milled than edible starch. Once applied to hair, it stays all day and does what the product description says. My scalp is quite on the oily side, without this product I usually have to wash my hair daily to maintain an airy texture. But with this powder, I can now wash my hair every other day, and sometimes every two days - it gives the freshly washed hair effect. You only need to apply a little bit each application, therefore this product will likely last you a long time (more than 6 months).  Overall, this is a decent product. The price does lean on the luxury side, but the packaging, scent, and performance of this product does drive up the price point. Could you find alternatives with similar performance at a lower price point? Yes. But is this product worth the splurge? Yes!

Not only do I end up with powder all over the place every single time I use this product, but I also end up with powder everywhere when I'm NOT using it because it somehow leaks through the twist cap and gets all over the jar. If this product came inside a brush applicator like others I've seen, this would be a 10/10 holy grail. Until then, it's an 8/10. In terms of convenience, Crown Affair Dry Shampoo reigns supreme. Its compact size and mess-free application make it an ideal companion for on-the-go touch-ups or travel adventures. reviews.review_text: Hey Beauties!   Reintroducing Crown Affair's cult classic, first-of-its-kind powder Dry Shampoo! Persimmon-derived Tannic Acid refreshes and deodorizes while Tsubaki Seed Oil prevents dryness and irritation, leaving hair cleansed with subtle volume without the grit of traditional aerosol products.  They revamped their original best-selling formula with new highly functional packaging. It now includes a recyclable refill component in order to reduce plastic usage and eliminate waste. The refill compenents will be available for separate purchases, so you can keep the base of the jar and kabauki brush every time you need a re-up. Plus, the package is larger, so now you get double the amount of our silky Dry Shampoo powder!  The Dry Shampoo comes with a fluffy kabuki brush for easy application of the fine powder. With the bigger packaging, you can now store the brush inside of the container for protection and long-lasting use. Or if it's your preference, you can store the brush in any sort of makeup bag.  Key Ingredients: Tapioca Starch Absorbs oils and enriches your scalp without talc.  Persimmon Powder Deodorizes and leaves hair smelling as clean as wash day.  Fragrance Description:  Their signature fragrance blend combines bergamot, yuzu, and lemongrass for a cool, light scent.  I'm absolutely in love with this Dry Shampoo. It's not your usual spray on which makes it very different. I was a tad skeptical at first, but let me tell you, I'm sold. This made my hair feel so fresh and clean. It also added more volume to my hair. A major plus there wasn't any leftover white powder in my hair.   Products Shown:  @CrownAffair~ The Refillable Dry Shampoo

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have a very important note to start this review on: I'm noticing the Sephora website says this has 0.3 oz of product. The jar itself says 1.1 oz (you can also see this in the product pictures). I hope Sephora fixes this as IMHO, it's very important to note the correct sizing so customers have an accurate idea of what they are purchasing!  Now on to the product. I have to admit that I am very pleased with this system. First off, the design itself is nothing short of brilliant. The brush is included along with the system, and it is stored in the lid. The product itself functions similarly to a pressed facial powder. You twist and dispense powder into the lid, dip the brush in, and apply on your scalp.  As for usage, this is much less messy compared to some other non-aerosol options as you have greater control over placement. There is also a nice, light scent while applying. There is not a lot of residue with this, which I think would suit non-blondes better than a lot of dry shampoos. I noticed that this product is especially effective at knocking out that oily scalp scent (might by iykyk)!  And finally, I am SO glad to see this is now a refillable system! One of my initial questions was, if i keep buying this, am i going to end up with way more brushes than I could possibly need? The answer seems to be no, as the refills will provide you with only what you need: more dry shampoo powder.  Overall, I am very pleased that Crown Affair has come out with a well-thought out system and an effective product.
